meanings.definition: The quality or state of being international.
meanings.sent1: The internationality of the conference brought together people from all over the world.
meanings.sent2: The internationality of the event was evident in the diverse languages spoken by the attendees.
meanings.sent3: The internationality of the soccer team made for interesting cultural exchanges during practice.
meanings.sent4: Her job required an understanding of the internationality of trade agreements.
meanings.sent5: The internationality of the organization's mission made it a global force for positive change.

meanings.definition: The condition of involving or relating to multiple countries or nations.
meanings.sent1: The internationality of the project required collaboration with teams from different countries.
meanings.sent2: The internationality of the trade deal impacted economies around the world.
meanings.sent3: The internationality of the food festival showcased dishes from various nations.
meanings.sent4: The internationality of the conflict called for diplomatic solutions from multiple governments.
meanings.sent5: The internationality of the company's operations made it a key player in global markets.
